page.title: 07The Manor House, Hilmarton.
page.content: Hilmarton Manor, which was built in 1820, is a very large house. It has eight bedrooms and three bathrooms upstairs.Downstairs it has a library, an office,a dining room, a kitchen and three other rooms. The Manor still has some elm floorboards and in one room it even has the original flagstones. Mr-Baile-De-Laperriere who owns the house runs a book company at the manor.He owns four acres including his garden.In the garden there are said to be the ghosts of three cavaliers that roam the garden and have been seen on a couple of occasions. In the gardens there is a large greenhouse, a walled garden and a paddock. In one part of the garden they used to have a tennis court and the outline still shows today. On the house is a balcony which overlooks where the tennis court was. There is also a stone built grotto.
